DataElement.preferredName: Cerebrospinal Fluid Diagnostic Procedure Cytology Contraindicated Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to cerebrospinal fluid cytology and contraindication (i.e., a particular method of treatment, regimen, procedure, and/or medication viewed as being unsuitable and/or inadvisable)._the yes/no indicator related to the patient's eligibility to participate in the clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cerebrospinal Fluid Diagnostic Procedure Cytology Contraindicated
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to cerebrospinal fluid cytology and contraindication (i.e., a particular method of treatment, regimen, procedure, and/or medication viewed as being unsuitable and/or inadvisable).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (seh-REE-broe-SPY-nal) The fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord. Cerebrospinal fluid is produced in the ventricles in the brain.:Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: Cytology; the branch of biology that studies the structure and function of cells.:To indicate the inadvisability of (a medical treatment, for example). (Dictionary.com)

Concepts.definition: The light microscopic study of normal and abnormal cells in fine needle aspirates (FNAs), body cavity fluids, and smears.
State of a particular method of treatment, regimen, procedure, medication, etc. of being unsuitable and inadvisable, often because of a likely adverse reaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
